notes_display: Part of a set of 14 facsimile notes in a red, white, and blue envelope. Possibly issued to commemorate the US Bicentennial in 1976. Each note has the word "COPY" printed in tiny letters in the bottom left corner of the front. Part of set "B"
issue_place_s: Hartford, Connecticut, United States of America
issue_obverse_legend_s: TEN SHILLINGS.  The possessor of this BILL shall be paid by the Treasurer of the STATE of Connecticut, TEN SHILLINGS, in Spanish milled Dollars, at the rate of six Shillings each, or other silver or gold Coins equivalent, with Interest at five per Cent. per Annum, by the 1st Day of March, A. D. 1784. BY ORDER of AS-SEMBLY. Dated at HARTFORD the first Day of JUNE, A. D. 1780.
issue_reverse_legend_s: Ten Shil. L. Money, June 1st, 1780.| New-London, Printed by T. Green.
